com.bwsoft.iris.message

Interface Message

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Field, Group, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SBEMessage

    public interface Message
extends Group
    A message is a special Group without a parent. It contains additional methods to wrap/create a messaqe buffer to return a GroupObject. The returned GroupObject can be used to get/set values of fields in this message.
    Author:
    yzhou
    See Also:
    GroupObject

    • Method Detail

      • wrapSbeBuffer

        GroupObject wrapSbeBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                          int offset)
        Wrap a buffer with SBE message and return a GroupObject to get or modify the values of fields in the message. Typically this is not directly called. Instead one should use a factory method such as SBEMessageSchema.wrapSbeBuffer(ByteBuffer, int) to wrap a buffer containing an unknown message.
        Parameters:
        buffer - a buffer containing the SBE message
        offset - the starting position of the SBE message in the buffer
        Returns:
        a GroupObject or null if this buffer does not contain the current SBEMessage

      • wrapSbeBuffer

        GroupObject wrapSbeBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                          int offset,
                          int length)
        Wrap a buffer with SBE message and return a GroupObject to get or modify the values of fields in the message. Typically this is not directly called. Instead one should use a factory method such as SBEMessageSchema.wrapSbeBuffer(ByteBuffer, int, int) to wrap a buffer containing an unknown message.
        Parameters:
        buffer - a buffer containing the SBE message
        offset - the starting position of the SBE message in the buffer
        length - buffer boundary
        Returns:
        a GroupObject or null if this buffer does not contain the current SBEMessage

      • wrapSbeBuffer

        GroupObject wrapSbeBuffer(byte[] buffer,
                          int offset)
        Wrap a buffer with SBE message and return a GroupObject to get or modify the values of fields in the message. Typically this is not directly called. Instead one should use a factory method such as SBEMessageSchema.wrapSbeBuffer(byte[], int) to wrap a buffer containing an unknown message.
        Parameters:
        buffer - a buffer containing the SBE message
        offset - the starting position of the SBE message in the buffer
        Returns:
        a GroupObject or null if this buffer does not contain the current SBEMessage

      • wrapSbeBuffer

        GroupObject wrapSbeBuffer(byte[] buffer,
                          int offset,
                          int length)
        Wrap a buffer with SBE message and return a GroupObject to get or modify the values of fields in the message. Typically this is not directly called. Instead one should use a factory method such as SBEMessageSchema.wrapSbeBuffer(byte[], int, int) to wrap a buffer containing an unknown message.
        Parameters:
        buffer - a buffer containing the SBE message
        offset - the starting position of the SBE message in the buffer
        length - buffer boundary
        Returns:
        a GroupObject or null if this buffer does not contain the current SBEMessage

      • createSbeBuffer

        GroupObject createSbeBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                            int offset)
        Create a SBE buffer using the provided buffer. It returns a GroupObject for setting the field values. Typically this is not directly called. Instead one should use a factory method such as SBEMessageSchema.createSbeBuffer(int, ByteBuffer, int) to wrap a buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - a buffer to hold the SBE message
        offset - the starting position to create the SBE message in the buffer
        Returns:
        a GroupObject to set fields in the message

      • createSbeBuffer

        GroupObject createSbeBuffer(byte[] buffer,
                            int offset)
        Create a SBE buffer using the provided buffer. It returns a GroupObject for setting the field values. Typically this is not directly called. Instead one should use a factory method such as SBEMessageSchema.createSbeBuffer(int, ByteBuffer, int) to wrap a buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - a buffer to hold the SBE message
        offset - the starting position to create the SBE message in the buffer
        Returns:
        a GroupObject to set fields in the message
